translation.55efc412d42fde8b5f9a58dbd44a5fd8:
Solid hulls are great for interior space having inbuilt dry storage in their core and compact sideboards.
Always use fenders when berthing or rafting as they can easily scratch or ding when in contact with other solid hull boats or quay sides.
translation.0937d287d57497e28797ad4239f93f20:
The command station is equipped with all the controls you need to manouver the boat. From this point you can change direction, adjust speed, start and stop the motor, observe the fuel and temperature gauges among others.
Never abandon the command station while the engine is running.
translation.7e24aa7ef66aeeaea5a165234f58b92d:
The command station is equipped with all the controls you need to use the boat. From this point you can change direction, adjust speed, start and stop the motor, observe the fuel and temperature gauges among others.
Never abandon the command station while the engine is running.
translation.6ee75c1ae5b10b89d62e2bf027e27053:
When in forward motion ,turning the helm to the left (anticlockwise) will turn the boat to the left.
Turning the helm to the right(clockwise) will turn the boat to the right.
translation.565b58a159d384d472859fc437da77fe:
When in reverse  motion, turning the helm to the left (anticlockwise) will turn the boat to the left.
Turning the helm to the right(clockwise) will turn the boat to the right.
translation.779669bbdf3737b07838db5b738f93d9: The KILL CORD is a corner stone to a safe trip.  Allways attach the kill cord  to yourself before starting  the engine. This device will STOP the engine if you accidentally fall over board or move away from the control station, avoiding injuries and the boat running away solo.
translation.972d2af8774b3a97dfab0cfc07798c50:
The CONTACT KEY has 3 positions:
Off: Turns off engine. No contact.
ON: Contact is made. The key will remain in this position after starting the motor.
Start: To start the engine. Once started release the key and it will return to ON.
translation.868ce5b814d7b68975170c81475e999b:
The gear shift and throttle are integrated in one unit. 
Allways transition from one gear to another gently and at very low speed to avoid shocking the gearbox.
Accelaration an decelaration must also be done gradually and slowly.
translation.c0478f6d45e539e05bd0768edb8ab7de:
We will start from NEUTRAL position.
To find neutral when the engine is OFF, push the throttle  all the way forwards and bring it back until you feel a click or transition. Now you are in neutral.
translation.54b2ccdefad5376e7b134fbeb1ea23b5:
From neutral position, gently push the leaver forward until you feel a click or transition. Now you are in FORWARD GEAR minimum power.
To accelerate, keep pushing the throttle forwards very slowly. Give the boat some time to speed up and avoid using maximum power for a prolonged time.
translation.b633fa4799305b2f0e39cb420eead9fc:
From neutral position, gently push the throttle backwards until you feel a click or transition.
Now you are in REVERSE GEAR minimum power.
You should only use up to 40% reverse power as it becomes inefficient after that point.
translation.184239c3bb764a91e8838bad9722c719:
The fuel gauge will indicate the amount of fuel in your tank.
Before departing, we will make sure the  tank is full for you.
Avoid running under 25% of the tank capacity.
translation.1b92eb9137766b1453e32c97aaca7942: In the rare event of the oil pressure alarm being activated, slow down for a minute. If the alarm persists contact base.
translation.8f9378b4a807cb4341c015ea9991da51:
The temperature gauge indicates the internal engine temperature.
When running, it should indicate digits close to 80-90 Cº.
In the rare event of temperature rising over 100Cº , gently slow down to minimum power for a minute. If it remains or continues to raise pick the closest safe anchorage and stop the motor
translation.4014e9f5e4e16a602f2cdc2a92f1d99a:
(Before starting the motor, make sure that no obstructions or persons are close to the propeller)

Connect the kill cord to the command station and to yourself.
translation.41ab0db7e79e46ce607deefa48403609: Bring  the gear shift to NEUTRAL position. If you can’t find it, push the shift all the way forwards and bring it back until you  feel  a click. Now you are in Neutral position.
translation.aee3f35bafdde2551262da9197060217:
Center the steering and turn the key clocwise until motor starts and release.

If the motor doesn’t start  within  5 seconds, stop for a minute, check previous steps, and try again.
translation.490def5b468216ee7458a1745366c59e:
Bring the gear shift to NEUTRAL position.
Transition from one position to another gently and at very  low speed.
translation.230f5238cfdeb1ccff07b54a823f9482:
Turn the CONTACT KEY anticlockwise to STOP position.
Make sure you are properly moored or anchored before stopping the engine.
translation.4e55a33138fc1e83eee57fc89201cac1: Remove the Kill Cord from your wrist/leg/life jacket.
translation.5802d5d344c85e5109819fd46c908cd5: To EMERGENCY STOP the motor at any moment, pull firmly from the KILL CORD until it disconnects from the command station.
translation.4424e7b1472c42fd02e6f409611473fb: We much appreciate if you could give us a ring 15 minutes previous to your arrival so we are ready to assist you in the maneuver.
translation.51728e52381eff2623d8eb6b41b694a4: Just before entering the port area, slow down at minimum speed and deploy your fenders. Position you crew correctly around the boat and give each one a task in handling the lines.
translation.c0a91fd887278a7753c8c4609ce75a50:
Before entering your mooring, take a moment to scan the area. 
Wait for any traffic to clear and anticipate your maneuver.
Take as much of a wide turn as possible and avoid maneuvering in sharp spots.
translation.20f8bde59e637304e493100c2d881169:
When ready to enter, proceed extremely slow alternating from Neutral to Forward as needed. You should be able to stop the boat instantly with a gentle reverse touch.
Agressive manouvering  can cause injuries and damage to your boat and others.
translation.8d6bcbe4cbd49255bd969d12a5f27f3f:
As soon as you receive a mooring line you can stop the engine.
Avoid making any corrections with the engine once you are in your berth.
We will guide you from here, well done!
translation.f6e0c250979475d8488f89a23c68e967:
On arrival to base, is customary to debrief.
We would love to hear if you had a good time, your favourite spots and if any issues arose during the trip.
We are constantly working on improving our service.
translation.e8fc2d461af4dca281be2d9cc3145010: Before departing, we will be run you through the boat and show you all the particularities of your model as well as brief you on the local coast and best locations. This is a good moment to clarify any doubts you may have before departing.
translation.2f70ef1569d6cf54293c797645659613:
On board, you will find a life jacket for all the adults. Please let us know in advance if any kids are coming so we can prepare one for each.
We recommend you to wear one if you’re not comfortable swimming or at any moment you may feel you need it.
Young kids unable to swim  and babies should wear one at all times.
translation.7e6b6032b71e3ccb84618d343ed42c3f:
The boat is equiped with on or more fire extinguishers for the unlikely event of a fire on board.
You will also have a SIGNAL FLARE available in case of the unlikely event of needing to signal a distress situation.
translation.716bd2ba0003509513a6b725e4c34420:
When boarding the boat, keep the weight evenly distributed  for best stability and comfort.
Move gently around it while you get used to the new space .
Avoid running or jumping around.
translation.c80ede09c11e00b5d5fe890c2791154b:
In port, keep to the right hand side of the chanel.
Keep your speed to MINIMUM  to avoid creating wake and damage to other moored boats. Anticipate your exit route and keep a sharp look out for traffic.
translation.70a7fd9844e0c4ce4f87f4cfe2e971ff:
Once you are ready to depart, start the motor and let it run for a minute while you position your crew to drop the lines.
It is normal to feel a little nervous before departing, so take a deep breath, crosscheck that all your crew is ready and in position.
translation.2048656756fedec530c953df7cd39bac:
Once you have departed the mooring area and keeping a low speed, collect your fenders and store them. Double check for any lines that may be hanging overboard.
Now you can proceed to speed up!
translation.d59779ec44705fb306044e7ad4a3e6df:
Take a moment to scan your surroundings, double check and wait for any traffic to clear.
Mentally anticipate your maneuver before executing.
translation.4d1f14c17db887722f6c3353e0d7f66a:
Once you have departed the port area, collect all your fenders and store them. Double heck for any lines that may be overboard.
We suggest you store your electronics in a dry compartment.
translation.a3960b745cbc56fc48e14b30efbf190f:
Once  the traffic has cleared, execute gently  but firmly at the minimum speed possible. Take all the space available and avoid maneuvering in tight spots.
Remember to keep a safe distance from other moored boats.
translation.90dda2e5bad250cfbe1a1534f34a8212:
When boarding the boat, keep the weight evenly distributed  for best stability and comfort.
Move gently around it while you get used to the new space .
translation.0add253b687b7c4c54a65bd9fac6f7f4:
When under way, make small adjustments to the helm to keep a straight course and best stability.
Big corrections will lead to curvy performance and a less comfortable ride.
translation.ccefa6ce0e98b77a8ebba64331d3085e:
Adjust your speed to the circumstances.
It’s ok to create a wake and move fast in the open sea but allways slow down when approaching an anchorage, point of interst, swiming area or in the port.
Wake can cause damage to moored boats and may ruin a luch at anchor if it all ends up on the floor.
translation.3c373a9c86fec94132c1d5b3875d9e11:
We have marked in the map the dangerous water rocks and shallows, anyhow, a safety distance must be kept from the shore at all times when cruising.
Please check your map often in order to locate the dangerous areas.
translation.388bb7f4515919a9130f3583c7dd5752:
Keep a sharp look out at all times.
You may encounter other boats, swimmers, kayaks, etc in unexpected locations.
If at any moment your not sure on how to proceed, gently slow down or even stop for a moment to reassess.
translation.5803780d26dc9c4762ef58782e309d98:
When cruising, you may encounter big swell created by the wake of a big motor boat or ship. 
In this case, slow down to minimum speed and approach the waves at a 45º angle.
Resume your course and speed once they are past.
translation.2e7af8cee05eda190a21d308684b0813:
Give way by crossing through the back of these vessels independently of the approach.
Allways anticipate and execute your maneuvers with time and avoid last minute actions.
translation.ba8336ec8cdc520ba335da5de7bf08c4:
When approaching another vessel head to head, both vessels will turn to the right and resume their course.
This manouver must be taken with anticipation and as soon as possible avoiding last minute calls.
translation.1f859293e9ee63669acc83e61d6d2b9e:
Give way to vessels approaching from your right hand side by crossing through the back of them.
Never cross their front path if you are the give way vessel.
translation.9d8b4e9ef0815ed2f80067bd4ed17b22:
Give way to  sailing vessels independently of their approach when they are sailing. 
If their sails are not up then apply the general rule to give way to vessels coming from the right hand side.
translation.5f883d90167f2cfb193f5638c4526eb0: When overtaking another vessel, kayak, windsurf etc. leave plenty safety distance between the boats.
translation.7fa860858889072f4fdab44dc6b559b4:
Anchoring, is the equivalent of the the hand brake in the car.
The anchor will grip to the sea bed and stop the boat from moving away from it.
In order for it to be effective, a minimum of x3 times the depth of chain and x5 times the depth of warp must be deployed.
translation.b6247aa36f2bd4fbccd0c6ea659f080f:
Although the anchor will stop the boat from moving away from it, it won’t stop you pivoting around it if the wind changes.
Always allow a 360º clearance around the anchor.
translation.156544a6bee3d3b3376628c35510c69a:
The best holding is over sand.
Otherwise choose small pebbles.
Avoid anchoring over seaweed, it is protected and keeps our waters clean.
Avoid anchoring over big boulders that could get your anchor stuck.
translation.0e8291619a49a2676764c1a516111970:
Make sure you have a minimum of 2 meters under the boat.
By anchoring in very shallow water you risk to hit the ground and cause damage to the engine and hull.
translation.ed3ac2da40eebb9c83bdfa67767beb6d:
An ideal anchoring spot will start at a minimum depth of 1.5m under the hull.
This will allow a comfortable amount of chain/warp scope to manage.
translation.e4c487b9c9b6473d4a3ba4b6924aa62b:
Anchoring in a deep spot where you can’t clearly see the seabed could result in a null or poor holding of the anchor.
Take your time to find an ideal spot.
translation.ba6d032c1828851e00f08f78de65ed37: Some beaches have a protected swimming area. This area is marked by yellow buoys. Never enter this area with the boat.
translation.3cbbaafacafb97719af3a935aeb7ece1:
When approaching your anchoring spot you may encounter swimmers between the anchored boats. Keep a sharp look out and proceed at minimum speed.
You should be able to stop the boat moving with no more than a gentle touch in reverse.
translation.552aea2964f176da564225f260950f4e:
When choosing an anchoring spot, apply the previous rules of depth, seabed and a 360º clearance around the point you drop the anchor.
Keep clear of the pivoting range of other boats.
translation.7bbc1655ec50d997c152b7824ef9ad19:
Once you have selected a spot, take a moment to mentally anticipate your maneuver.
Approach your spot from down wind.
The other boats will be pointing in to the wind if any.
Proceed slowly and in total control.
translation.8fc10540925bc32ee1ef870c367e0e2e: Once you reach the center of your selected anchoring spot, proceed to drop the anchor as we show you next.
translation.07846e3c6fedc2cddd59c4b594fa7a75:
It is very important that the boat is not moving forwards at this point.
Once to boat has STOPPED moving forwards, deploy the anchor as you count the meters of chain/warp until you feel the anchor touch the seabed.
translation.7d1cc3709b447ba4217a09a8c2912b52:
Reverse at minimum speed, keep deploying the anchor applying the scope rule.
Remember you have already deployed 1x length, so deploy x2 length more if chain or x4 lenghts more if warp.
Carry out this maneuver very slowly, alternate from REVERSE to Neutral in order to achieve this.
translation.d56ec94950356825145548d5b6af1114:
Once the right amount of scope is out, secure the chain or warp and gently reverse on it until it gets tight.
Continue to gently reverse and check that you are not moving taking a reference to the seabed or a landmark.
translation.e238ec9d5b65bff23266128bc5b9edf6:
Once you are sure you are holding well, shift to neutral and proceed to stop the engine.
Well Done!
Take a moment now  to cross check that all is good.
translation.a15129ae357eab03368c730fa4cf74f7: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor..
translation.46d624ec64c45c3814481bcb25b8b2c3: Before entering the water, make sure your engine is off and deploy your swimmimg ladder .
translation.88a61cda987f3fb3977b47603c4573cb: Don’t swim with the kill cord or the keys. If you are going to go to the shore, it’s best to hide it under a cushion or in a compartment.
translation.bfd349595e881866c8ca71e30346602b: Before you start the motor pull up the swimming ladder  and make sure  no towels or swimwear are hanging from the side of the boat.
translation.cc306b697bc908ed8ef9b5b0f88aa83e:
Position your crew in order to lift the anchor.
Start the motor and let it run for a minute while you mentally anticipate your maneuver and exit route.
translation.d7d9f343fde747f60d66b2e11e91f7d5:
Once you are ready to start, with the engine running in NEUTRAL, proceed to pull up the anchor. 
The ancor must be pulled up slowly but continuously.
translation.999f4db98c8b1cb7d1cc81fed37936b7: Before engaging in forward motion get a confirmation from your crew that the anchor is fully up and on board.
translation.edfcd839dc3d6e235ebe6a920439a99d:
Proceed to depart the anchorage at minimum speed.
Remember to keep a sharp look out for swimmers.
translation.958a0b98afe5f5831e60867bb5fd74fe:
-Do not drink when  operating the boat.
Serious penalties apply in most countries.
-Do not disturb anchorages by being to loud. Go with the flow!
-Do not polute the sea in any way.
-Do not smoke near the engine or gas. tank.
translation.bd7b858dc6d83a6c861332b36f02992e:
In the rare event of the motor suddenly stopping under way, keep calm and check if the KILL CORD has accidentaly been removed. 
If so, reconnect it and proceed with the START MOTOR steps.
translation.9f05b78385f9cfe977b5ab97b18012fa:
If not succesful and close to shore, proceed to anchor the boat.
If possible, let out and extra length or two of chain or warp.
translation.aff3d3ec5b10dc73537f15dc11cd5f68:
Once you ‘re anchored, check if a warp or debris have seized the propeller.
If the water is calm, you can deploy your swimming ladder and try to untangle or cut it free.
Proceed now with the PICK UP ANCHOR process.
translation.e02062b307bdbd225b57aea07d75ef7b:
If the propeller is free and the engine is not starting, locate the rubber fuel pump and press it several times untill it becomes hard.
Now, proceed with the Start Motor process.
translation.6aca73d044bb93749abcdd2140e765e5: If you are not successful or feel uncomfortable doing any of the previous procedures please give us a call for assistance.
translation.3b1410d4d0ef3384139e7d2c368def5a:
If a person falls over board take a wide turn and gain distance (20m) downwind. Never lose eye contact with the M.O.B
Then proceed upwind and approach with great care and minimum speed.
Just before making contact with the M.O.B make sure to put the enging in NEUTRAL or STOP the ENGINE.
translation.bdcccfeefafe9464d26f3958e785caa2: Deploy the swimming lader and assist in getting the M.O.B back on board.
translation.0dc977ce2b0538a26ef6d9382e571aee:
If the anchor gets stuck, you can try to free it by swiming on top of it and pulling the warp or chain in different angles.
If succesfull, don’t take it back with you. Swim back to the boat and proceed with the  ANCHOR PICK UP.
translation.083825bbea65298cf69e5167a183886c:
If not succesfull, please take a screen shot of the location on the APP MAP and inform us.
Do not put yourself or the boat in danger by trying too hard.
An anchor is not to expencive and can be replaced.

translation.55efc412d42fde8b5f9a58dbd44a5fd8:
Solid hulls are great for interior space having inbuilt dry storage in their core and compact sideboards.
Always use fenders when berthing or rafting as they can easily scratch or ding when in contact with other solid hull boats or quay sides.

The command station is equipped with all the controls you need to manouver the boat. From this point you can change direction, adjust speed, start and stop the motor, observe the fuel and temperature gauges among others.
Never abandon the command station while the engine is running.

Never abandon the command station while the engine is running.

Turning the helm to the right(clockwise) will turn the boat to the right.
translation.565b58a159d384d472859fc437da77fe:

Turning the helm to the right(clockwise) will turn the boat to the right.

translation.d59779ec44705fb306044e7ad4a3e6df:
Take a moment to scan your surroundings, double check and wait for any traffic to clear.
Mentally anticipate your maneuver before executing.
translation.4d1f14c17db887722f6c3353e0d7f66a:
Once you have departed the port area, collect all your fenders and store them. Double heck for any lines that may be overboard.
We suggest you store your electronics in a dry compartment.
translation.a3960b745cbc56fc48e14b30efbf190f:
Once  the traffic has cleared, execute gently  but firmly at the minimum speed possible. Take all the space available and avoid maneuvering in tight spots.
Remember to keep a safe distance from other moored boats.
translation.90dda2e5bad250cfbe1a1534f34a8212:
When boarding the boat, keep the weight evenly distributed  for best stability and comfort.
Move gently around it while you get used to the new space .
translation.0add253b687b7c4c54a65bd9fac6f7f4:
When under way, make small adjustments to the helm to keep a straight course and best stability.
Big corrections will lead to curvy performance and a less comfortable ride.
translation.ccefa6ce0e98b77a8ebba64331d3085e:
Adjust your speed to the circumstances.
It’s ok to create a wake and move fast in the open sea but allways slow down when approaching an anchorage, point of interst, swiming area or in the port.
Wake can cause damage to moored boats and may ruin a luch at anchor if it all ends up on the floor.
translation.3c373a9c86fec94132c1d5b3875d9e11:
We have marked in the map the dangerous water rocks and shallows, anyhow, a safety distance must be kept from the shore at all times when cruising.
Please check your map often in order to locate the dangerous areas.
translation.388bb7f4515919a9130f3583c7dd5752:
Keep a sharp look out at all times.
You may encounter other boats, swimmers, kayaks, etc in unexpected locations.
If at any moment your not sure on how to proceed, gently slow down or even stop for a moment to reassess.
translation.5803780d26dc9c4762ef58782e309d98:
When cruising, you may encounter big swell created by the wake of a big motor boat or ship. 
In this case, slow down to minimum speed and approach the waves at a 45º angle.
Resume your course and speed once they are past.
translation.2e7af8cee05eda190a21d308684b0813:
Give way by crossing through the back of these vessels independently of the approach.
Allways anticipate and execute your maneuvers with time and avoid last minute actions.
translation.ba8336ec8cdc520ba335da5de7bf08c4:
When approaching another vessel head to head, both vessels will turn to the right and resume their course.
This manouver must be taken with anticipation and as soon as possible avoiding last minute calls.
translation.1f859293e9ee63669acc83e61d6d2b9e:
Give way to vessels approaching from your right hand side by crossing through the back of them.
Never cross their front path if you are the give way vessel.
translation.9d8b4e9ef0815ed2f80067bd4ed17b22:
Give way to  sailing vessels independently of their approach when they are sailing. 
If their sails are not up then apply the general rule to give way to vessels coming from the right hand side.
translation.5f883d90167f2cfb193f5638c4526eb0: When overtaking another vessel, kayak, windsurf etc. leave plenty safety distance between the boats.
translation.7fa860858889072f4fdab44dc6b559b4:
Anchoring, is the equivalent of the the hand brake in the car.
The anchor will grip to the sea bed and stop the boat from moving away from it.
In order for it to be effective, a minimum of x3 times the depth of chain and x5 times the depth of warp must be deployed.
translation.b6247aa36f2bd4fbccd0c6ea659f080f:
Although the anchor will stop the boat from moving away from it, it won’t stop you pivoting around it if the wind changes.
Always allow a 360º clearance around the anchor.
translation.156544a6bee3d3b3376628c35510c69a:
The best holding is over sand.
Otherwise choose small pebbles.
Avoid anchoring over seaweed, it is protected and keeps our waters clean.
Avoid anchoring over big boulders that could get your anchor stuck.
translation.0e8291619a49a2676764c1a516111970:
Make sure you have a minimum of 2 meters under the boat.
By anchoring in very shallow water you risk to hit the ground and cause damage to the engine and hull.
translation.ed3ac2da40eebb9c83bdfa67767beb6d:
An ideal anchoring spot will start at a minimum depth of 1.5m under the hull.
This will allow a comfortable amount of chain/warp scope to manage.
translation.e4c487b9c9b6473d4a3ba4b6924aa62b:
Anchoring in a deep spot where you can’t clearly see the seabed could result in a null or poor holding of the anchor.
Take your time to find an ideal spot.
translation.ba6d032c1828851e00f08f78de65ed37: Some beaches have a protected swimming area. This area is marked by yellow buoys. Never enter this area with the boat.
translation.3cbbaafacafb97719af3a935aeb7ece1:
When approaching your anchoring spot you may encounter swimmers between the anchored boats. Keep a sharp look out and proceed at minimum speed.
You should be able to stop the boat moving with no more than a gentle touch in reverse.
translation.552aea2964f176da564225f260950f4e:
When choosing an anchoring spot, apply the previous rules of depth, seabed and a 360º clearance around the point you drop the anchor.
Keep clear of the pivoting range of other boats.
translation.7bbc1655ec50d997c152b7824ef9ad19:
Once you have selected a spot, take a moment to mentally anticipate your maneuver.
Approach your spot from down wind.
The other boats will be pointing in to the wind if any.
Proceed slowly and in total control.
translation.8fc10540925bc32ee1ef870c367e0e2e: Once you reach the center of your selected anchoring spot, proceed to drop the anchor as we show you next.
translation.07846e3c6fedc2cddd59c4b594fa7a75:
It is very important that the boat is not moving forwards at this point.
Once to boat has STOPPED moving forwards, deploy the anchor as you count the meters of chain/warp until you feel the anchor touch the seabed.
translation.7d1cc3709b447ba4217a09a8c2912b52:
Reverse at minimum speed, keep deploying the anchor applying the scope rule.
Remember you have already deployed 1x length, so deploy x2 length more if chain or x4 lenghts more if warp.
Carry out this maneuver very slowly, alternate from REVERSE to Neutral in order to achieve this.
translation.d56ec94950356825145548d5b6af1114:
Once the right amount of scope is out, secure the chain or warp and gently reverse on it until it gets tight.
Continue to gently reverse and check that you are not moving taking a reference to the seabed or a landmark.
translation.e238ec9d5b65bff23266128bc5b9edf6:
Once you are sure you are holding well, shift to neutral and proceed to stop the engine.
Well Done!
Take a moment now  to cross check that all is good.
translation.a15129ae357eab03368c730fa4cf74f7: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor..
translation.46d624ec64c45c3814481bcb25b8b2c3: Before entering the water, make sure your engine is off and deploy your swimmimg ladder .
translation.88a61cda987f3fb3977b47603c4573cb: Don’t swim with the kill cord or the keys. If you are going to go to the shore, it’s best to hide it under a cushion or in a compartment.
translation.bfd349595e881866c8ca71e30346602b: Before you start the motor pull up the swimming ladder  and make sure  no towels or swimwear are hanging from the side of the boat.
translation.cc306b697bc908ed8ef9b5b0f88aa83e:
Position your crew in order to lift the anchor.
Start the motor and let it run for a minute while you mentally anticipate your maneuver and exit route.
translation.d7d9f343fde747f60d66b2e11e91f7d5:
Once you are ready to start, with the engine running in NEUTRAL, proceed to pull up the anchor. 
The ancor must be pulled up slowly but continuously.
translation.999f4db98c8b1cb7d1cc81fed37936b7: Before engaging in forward motion get a confirmation from your crew that the anchor is fully up and on board.
translation.edfcd839dc3d6e235ebe6a920439a99d:
Proceed to depart the anchorage at minimum speed.
Remember to keep a sharp look out for swimmers.
translation.958a0b98afe5f5831e60867bb5fd74fe:
-Do not drink when  operating the boat.
Serious penalties apply in most countries.
-Do not disturb anchorages by being to loud. Go with the flow!
-Do not polute the sea in any way.
-Do not smoke near the engine or gas. tank.
translation.bd7b858dc6d83a6c861332b36f02992e:
In the rare event of the motor suddenly stopping under way, keep calm and check if the KILL CORD has accidentaly been removed. 
If so, reconnect it and proceed with the START MOTOR steps.
translation.9f05b78385f9cfe977b5ab97b18012fa:
If not succesful and close to shore, proceed to anchor the boat.
If possible, let out and extra length or two of chain or warp.
translation.aff3d3ec5b10dc73537f15dc11cd5f68:
Once you ‘re anchored, check if a warp or debris have seized the propeller.
If the water is calm, you can deploy your swimming ladder and try to untangle or cut it free.
Proceed now with the PICK UP ANCHOR process.
translation.e02062b307bdbd225b57aea07d75ef7b:
If the propeller is free and the engine is not starting, locate the rubber fuel pump and press it several times untill it becomes hard.
Now, proceed with the Start Motor process.
translation.6aca73d044bb93749abcdd2140e765e5: If you are not successful or feel uncomfortable doing any of the previous procedures please give us a call for assistance.
translation.3b1410d4d0ef3384139e7d2c368def5a:
If a person falls over board take a wide turn and gain distance (20m) downwind. Never lose eye contact with the M.O.B
Then proceed upwind and approach with great care and minimum speed.
Just before making contact with the M.O.B make sure to put the enging in NEUTRAL or STOP the ENGINE.
translation.bdcccfeefafe9464d26f3958e785caa2: Deploy the swimming lader and assist in getting the M.O.B back on board.
translation.0dc977ce2b0538a26ef6d9382e571aee:
If the anchor gets stuck, you can try to free it by swiming on top of it and pulling the warp or chain in different angles.
If succesfull, don’t take it back with you. Swim back to the boat and proceed with the  ANCHOR PICK UP.
translation.083825bbea65298cf69e5167a183886c:
If not succesfull, please take a screen shot of the location on the APP MAP and inform us.
Do not put yourself or the boat in danger by trying too hard.
An anchor is not to expencive and can be replaced.
